Key Arguments: The proposed legislation represents a dangerous overreach by the government, potentially restricting free speech.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth in public discourse.
Historical examples show that government censorship has often been erroneous and harmful.
Recent government actions during the COVID-19 pandemic are cited as examples of censorship, where dissenting voices were allegedly suppressed.
Notable Quotes: We cannot allow any government to be the arbiter of truth in the day to day conversations that will play out in the community.
Such censorship is the stuff of dictatorships anywhere the time of Socrates, Martin Luther, Galileo Galilei, Bertrand Russell, and all of the communist regimes of the 20th century.
